commands.name: bundle
commands.description: Build the bundle for the provided JavaScript entry file.

options.name: --entry-file <path>
options.description: Path to the root JS file, either absolute or relative to JS root

options.name: --platform <string>
options.description: Either "ios" or "android"

options.name: --transformer <string>
options.description: Specify a custom transformer to be used

options.name: --dev [boolean]
options.description: If false, warnings are disabled and the bundle is minified

options.name: --minify [boolean]
options.description: Allows overriding whether bundle is minified. This defaults to false if dev is true, and true if dev is false. Disabling minification can be useful for speeding up production builds for testing purposes.

options.name: --bundle-output <string>
options.description: File name where to store the resulting bundle, ex. /tmp/groups.bundle

options.name: --bundle-encoding <string>
options.description: Encoding the bundle should be written in (https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#buffer_buffer).

options.name: --max-workers <number>
options.description: Specifies the maximum number of workers the worker-pool will spawn for transforming files. This defaults to the number of the cores available on your machine.

options.name: --sourcemap-output <string>
options.description: File name where to store the sourcemap file for resulting bundle, ex. /tmp/groups.map

options.name: --sourcemap-sources-root <string>
options.description: Path to make sourcemap's sources entries relative to, ex. /root/dir

options.name: --sourcemap-use-absolute-path
options.description: Report SourceMapURL using its full path

options.name: --assets-dest <string>
options.description: Directory name where to store assets referenced in the bundle

options.name: --unstable-transform-profile <string>
options.description: Experimental, transform JS for a specific JS engine. Currently supported: hermes, hermes-canary, default

options.name: --asset-catalog-dest [string]
options.description: Path where to create an iOS Asset Catalog for images

options.name: --reset-cache
options.description: Removes cached files

options.name: --read-global-cache
options.description: Try to fetch transformed JS code from the global cache, if configured.

options.name: --config <string>
options.description: Path to the CLI configuration file

options.name: --resolver-option <string...>
options.description: Custom resolver options of the form key=value. URL-encoded. May be specified multiple times.

commands.name: start
commands.description: Start the React Native development server.

options.name: --projectRoot <path>
options.description: Path to a custom project root

options.name: --watchFolders <list>
options.description: Specify any additional folders to be added to the watch list

options.name: --assetPlugins <list>
options.description: Specify any additional asset plugins to be used by the packager by full filepath

options.name: --sourceExts <list>
options.description: Specify any additional source extensions to be used by the packager

options.name: --max-workers <number>
options.description: Specifies the maximum number of workers the worker-pool will spawn for transforming files. This defaults to the number of the cores available on your machine.

options.name: --transformer <string>
options.description: Specify a custom transformer to be used

options.name: --reset-cache, --resetCache
options.description: Removes cached files

options.name: --custom-log-reporter-path, --customLogReporterPath <string>
options.description: Path to a JavaScript file that exports a log reporter as a replacement for TerminalReporter

options.name: --https
options.description: Enables https connections to the server

options.name: --key <path>
options.description: Path to custom SSL key

options.name: --cert <path>
options.description: Path to custom SSL cert

options.name: --config <string>
options.description: Path to the CLI configuration file

options.name: --no-interactive
options.description: Disables interactive mode

options.name: --client-logs
options.description: [Deprecated] Enable plain text JavaScript log streaming for all connected apps. This feature is deprecated and will be removed in future.

options.name: --path <path>
options.description: Path to the React Native project root.

options.name: --platform <string>
options.description: Target platform. Supported values: "android", "ios", "all".

options.name: --outputPath <path>
options.description: Path where generated artifacts will be output to.

options.name: --source <string>
options.description: Whether the script is invoked from an `app` or a `library`

options.name: -i --interactive
options.description: Explicitly select simulator to tail logs from. By default it will tail logs from the first booted and available simulator.

commands.name: run-ios
commands.description: builds your app and starts it on iOS simulator

examples.desc: Run on a different simulator, e.g. iPhone SE (2nd generation)
Run on a connected device, e.g. Max's iPhone

options.name: --no-packager
options.description: Do not launch packager while running the app

options.name: --terminal <string>
options.description: Launches the Metro Bundler in a new window using the specified terminal path.

options.name: --binary-path <string>
options.description: Path relative to project root where pre-built .app binary lives.

options.name: --list-devices
options.description: List all available iOS devices and simulators and let you choose one to run the app.

options.name: --udid <string>
options.description: Explicitly set the device to use by UDID

options.name: --simulator <string>
options.description: Explicitly set the simulator to use. Optionally set the iOS version between parentheses at the end to match an exact version: "iPhone 15 (17.0)"

options.name: --mode <string>
options.description: Explicitly set the scheme configuration to use. This option is case sensitive.

options.name: --scheme <string>
options.description: Explicitly set Xcode scheme to use

options.name: --destination <string>
options.description: Explicitly extend destination e.g. "arch=x86_64"

options.name: --verbose
options.description: Do not use xcbeautify or xcpretty even if installed

options.name: --xcconfig [string]
options.description: Explicitly set xcconfig to use

options.name: --buildFolder <string>
options.description: Location for iOS build artifacts. Corresponds to Xcode's "-derivedDataPath".

options.name: --extra-params <string>
options.description: Custom params that will be passed to xcodebuild command.

options.name: --target <string>
options.description: Explicitly set Xcode target to use.

options.name: -i --interactive
options.description: Explicitly select which scheme and configuration to use before running a build

options.name: --force-pods
options.description: Force CocoaPods installation

options.name: --device [string]
options.description: Explicitly set the device to use by name or by unique device identifier . If the value is not provided,the app will run on the first available physical device.

commands.name: build-ios
commands.description: builds your app for iOS platform

examples.desc: Build the app for all iOS devices in Release mode

options.name: --mode <string>
options.description: Explicitly set the scheme configuration to use. This option is case sensitive.

options.name: --scheme <string>
options.description: Explicitly set Xcode scheme to use

options.name: --destination <string>
options.description: Explicitly extend destination e.g. "arch=x86_64"

options.name: --verbose
options.description: Do not use xcbeautify or xcpretty even if installed

options.name: --xcconfig [string]
options.description: Explicitly set xcconfig to use

options.name: --buildFolder <string>
options.description: Location for iOS build artifacts. Corresponds to Xcode's "-derivedDataPath".

options.name: --extra-params <string>
options.description: Custom params that will be passed to xcodebuild command.

options.name: --target <string>
options.description: Explicitly set Xcode target to use.

options.name: -i --interactive
options.description: Explicitly select which scheme and configuration to use before running a build

options.name: --force-pods
options.description: Force CocoaPods installation

options.name: --device [string]
options.description: Explicitly set the device to use by name or by unique device identifier . If the value is not provided,the app will run on the first available physical device.

commands.name: run-android
commands.description: builds your app and starts it on a connected Android emulator or device

options.name: --mode <string>
options.description: Specify your app's build variant

options.name: --tasks <list>
options.description: Run custom Gradle tasks. By default it's "assembleDebug". Will override passed mode and variant arguments.

options.name: --active-arch-only
options.description: Build native libraries only for the current device architecture for debug builds.

options.name: --extra-params <string>
options.description: Custom params passed to gradle build command

options.name: --interactive
options.description: Explicitly select build type and flavour to use before running a build

options.name: --no-packager
options.description: Do not launch packager while running the app

options.name: --terminal <string>
options.description: Launches the Metro Bundler in a new window using the specified terminal path.

options.name: --appId <string>
options.description: Specify an applicationId to launch after build. If not specified, `package` from AndroidManifest.xml will be used.

options.name: --appIdSuffix <string>
options.description: Specify an applicationIdSuffix to launch after build.

options.name: --main-activity <string>
options.description: Name of the activity to start

options.name: --deviceId <string>
options.description: builds your app and starts it on a specific device/simulator with the given device id (listed by running "adb devices" on the command line).

options.name: --list-devices
options.description: Lists all available Android devices and simulators and let you choose one to run the app

options.name: --binary-path <string>
options.description: Path relative to project root where pre-built .apk binary lives.

options.name: --user <number>
options.description: Id of the User Profile you want to install the app on.

options.name: --mode <string>
options.description: Specify your app's build variant

options.name: --tasks <list>
options.description: Run custom Gradle tasks. By default it's "assembleDebug". Will override passed mode and variant arguments.

options.name: --active-arch-only
options.description: Build native libraries only for the current device architecture for debug builds.

options.name: --extra-params <string>
options.description: Custom params passed to gradle build command

options.name: --interactive
options.description: Explicitly select build type and flavour to use before running a build
